net.grinder.engine.process
Interface ScriptEngine

All Known Implementing Classes:
JythonScriptEngine
public interface ScriptEngine

Factory for proxies.

Author:
Philip Aston

Nested Class Summary
static interface ScriptEngine.Recorder
          Interface to the test instrumentation.
static class ScriptEngine.ScriptExecutionException
          Indicates a script execution problem.
static interface ScriptEngine.WorkerRunnable
          Interface to the runnable script object for a particular worker thread.

Method Detail

initialise

void initialise(ScriptLocation script)
                throws EngineException
Run any process initialisation required by the script. Called once per ScriptEngine instance, before any of the other methods.

Parameters:
script - The script.
Throws:
EngineException - If process initialisation failed.

createWorkerRunnable

ScriptEngine.WorkerRunnable createWorkerRunnable()
                                                 throws EngineException
Create a ScriptEngine.WorkerRunnable that will be used to run the work for one worker thread. The ScriptEngine.WorkerRunnable will forward to a new instance of the script's TestRunner class. of the script's TestRunner class should be used.

Returns:
The runnable.
Throws:
EngineException - If the runnable could not be created.

createWorkerRunnable

ScriptEngine.WorkerRunnable createWorkerRunnable(Object testRunner)
                                                 throws EngineException
Create a ScriptEngine.WorkerRunnable that will be used to run the work for one worker thread. The ScriptEngine.WorkerRunnable will forward to a the supplied testRunner.

Parameters:
testRunner - An existing script instance that is callable.
Returns:
The runnable.
Throws:
EngineException - If the runnable could not be created.

shutdown

void shutdown()
              throws EngineException
Shut down the engine.

Throws:
EngineException - If the engine could not be shut down.

getDescription

String getDescription()
Returns a description of the script engine for the log.

Returns:
The description.
